lines.text: The cabin was just home. Just me, my father. And he died, and it was just me.
Up there by the lake there was no need to earn anything. You don't owe, you don't need. You just live.
Just asking if you're going to be a policeman like your old man here?
Yeah, yeah, a policeman or a violinist.
I've been married and divorced since I saw you last. Twice.

[caught driving police car]
Boy you guys sure take your speeding seriously in this Province.

Most kids grow up with "don't fight me", "do your homework", "eat your dinner", "keep off the grass". Now for the first time this kid has found somebody who doesn't give a shit about the rules. A friend who probably listens to him, who scares him, he likes him, and who definitely never says, "what the hell do you know, you're just a kid". They both broke out of prison.
Yeah well, how come they're having such a great time and we're not?
Because it's our job to put them back in.
Funny thing about trains, they take people apart.
You promised to come and visit me, now.

[starting to sing]
I took my hat and fourteen dollars / and I went through all the troubles / of the life that always follows. / When you're rich and huntin' romance / But my huntin' days are over I can tell you that...
